intro: Sisyrinchium pachyrhizum subsp. pertenue, commonly known as the long-root blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, showy blue to violet flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system, with some roots being notably long and thick. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Iridaceae family.
